intro: Uragoga monanthos, commonly known as the single-flowered uragoga, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological features. Its leaves are usually opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Uragoga monanthos is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
